quote: Everyone had high hopes for me, which was quite a lot of pressure. But I managed to turn it into positive energy. At the beginning, I didn't feel that fast, but halfway through, I realized it was possible. I'm happy that I could really deliver my maximum performance on the day.
This is such a cool race, I can recommend participation to everyone. This is my fifth time starting, and it has always been my dream to sit on the throne here!
Made a few runs this evening. Course is in awesome shape! Even if we get a little rain it will still be good, maybe even bit a little better.

Just received an update from the Rangers: Trails are closed because in some places they are 3 feet under the flooded lake. We will give them two days to dry out after the water recedes below them today. It is looking like we will open all trails on Sunday Morning.

It will be the same course as last time. It starts on the Core trail at the top, cuts into a small section that's not on the map that connects down into #6 and finishes on the walking track. It's pretty fun and flowy...weather is still looking good too!
Yeah I'm going out Friday morning to tape everything off. The ride around for the jumps will be left open for XC riders until Saturday morning. All jumps will be required but all can be rolled.
